                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SERVILIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">May it please your honour, my lord hath sent--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCILIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ha! what has he sent? I am so much endeared to</div>
                     <div class="line">that lord; he's ever sending: how shall I thank</div>
                     <div class="line">him, thinkest thou? And what has he sent now?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SERVILIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Has only sent his present occasion now, my lord;</div>
                     <div class="line">requesting your lordship to supply his instant use</div>
                     <div class="line">with so many talents.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCILIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I know his lordship is but merry with me;</div>
                     <div class="line">He cannot want fifty five hundred talents.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SERVILIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">But in the mean time he wants less, my lord.</div>
                     <div class="line">If his occasion were not virtuous,</div>
                     <div class="line">I should not urge it half so faithfully.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCILIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Dost thou speak seriously, Servilius?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SERVILIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon my soul,'tis true, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCILIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What a wicked beast was I to disfurnish myself</div>
                     <div class="line">against such a good time, when I might ha' shown</div>
                     <div class="line">myself honourable! how unluckily it happened, that I</div>
                     <div class="line">should purchase the day before for a little part,</div>
                     <div class="line">and undo a great deal of honoured! Servilius, now,</div>
                     <div class="line">before the gods, I am not able to do,--the more</div>
                     <div class="line">beast, I say:--I was sending to use Lord Timon</div>
                     <div class="line">myself, these gentlemen can witness! but I would</div>
                     <div class="line">not, for the wealth of Athens, I had done't now.</div>
                     <div class="line">Commend me bountifully to his good lordship; and I</div>
                     <div class="line">hope his honour will conceive the fairest of me,</div>
                     <div class="line">because I have no power to be kind: and tell him</div>
                     <div class="line">this from me, I count it one of my greatest</div>
                     <div class="line">afflictions, say, that I cannot pleasure such an</div>
                     <div class="line">honourable gentleman. Good Servilius, will you</div>
                     <div class="line">befriend me so far, as to use mine own words to him?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SERVILIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, sir, I shall.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCILIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll look you out a good turn, Servilius.</div>
                     <p>Exit SERVILIUS</p>
                     <div class="line">True as you said, Timon is shrunk indeed;</div>
                     <div class="line">And he that's once denied will hardly speed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Stranger</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you observe this, Hostilius?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Stranger</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, too well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Stranger</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, this is the world's soul; and just of the</div>
                     <div class="line">same piece</div>
                     <div class="line">Is every flatterer's spirit. Who can call him</div>
                     <div class="line">His friend that dips in the same dish? for, in</div>
                     <div class="line">My knowing, Timon has been this lord's father,</div>
                     <div class="line">And kept his credit with his purse,</div>
                     <div class="line">Supported his estate; nay, Timon's money</div>
                     <div class="line">Has paid his men their wages: he ne'er drinks,</div>
                     <div class="line">But Timon's silver treads upon his lip;</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet--O, see the monstrousness of man</div>
                     <div class="line">When he looks out in an ungrateful shape!--</div>
                     <div class="line">He does deny him, in respect of his,</div>
                     <div class="line">What charitable men afford to beggars.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Stranger</div>
                     <div class="line">Religion groans at it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Stranger</div>
                     <div class="line">For mine own part,</div>
                     <div class="line">I never tasted Timon in my life,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor came any of his bounties over me,</div>
                     <div class="line">To mark me for his friend; yet, I protest,</div>
                     <div class="line">For his right noble mind, illustrious virtue</div>
                     <div class="line">And honourable carriage,</div>
                     <div class="line">Had his necessity made use of me,</div>
                     <div class="line">I would have put my wealth into donation,</div>
                     <div class="line">And the best half should have return'd to him,</div>
                     <div class="line">So much I love his heart: but, I perceive,</div>
                     <div class="line">Men must learn now with pity to dispense;</div>
                     <div class="line">For policy sits above conscience.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  A room in Sempronius' house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter SEMPRONIUS, and a Servant of TIMON's</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SEMPRONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Must he needs trouble me in 't,--hum!--'bove</div>
                     <div class="line">all others?</div>
                     <div class="line">He might have tried Lord Lucius or Lucullus;</div>
                     <div class="line">And now Ventidius is wealthy too,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom he redeem'd from prison: all these</div>
                     <div class="line">Owe their estates unto him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">They have all been touch'd and found base metal, for</div>
                     <div class="line">They have au denied him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SEMPRONIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">How! have they denied him?</div>
                     <div class="line">Has Ventidius and Lucullus denied him?</div>
                     <div class="line">And does he send to me? Three? hum!</div>
                     <div class="line">It shows but little love or judgment in him:</div>
                     <div class="line">Must I be his last refuge! His friends, like</div>
                     <div class="line">physicians,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thrive, give him over: must I take the cure upon me?</div>
                     <div class="line">Has much disgraced me in't; I'm angry at him,</div>
                     <div class="line">That might have known my place: I see no sense for't,</div>
                     <div class="line">But his occasion might have woo'd me first;</div>
                     <div class="line">For, in my conscience, I was the first man</div>
                     <div class="line">That e'er received gift from him:</div>
                     <div class="line">And does he think so backwardly of me now,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I'll requite its last? No:</div>
                     <div class="line">So it may prove an argument of laughter</div>
                     <div class="line">To the rest, and 'mongst lords I be thought a fool.</div>
                     <div class="line">I'ld rather than the worth of thrice the sum,</div>
                     <div class="line">Had sent to me first, but for my mind's sake;</div>
                     <div class="line">I'd such a courage to do him good. But now return,</div>
                     <div class="line">And with their faint reply this answer join;</div>
                     <div class="line">Who bates mine honour shall not know my coin.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Excellent! Your lordship's a goodly villain. The</div>
                     <div class="line">devil knew not what he did when he made man</div>
                     <div class="line">politic; he crossed himself by 't: and I cannot</div>
                     <div class="line">think but, in the end, the villainies of man will</div>
                     <div class="line">set him clear. How fairly this lord strives to</div>
                     <div class="line">appear foul! takes virtuous copies to be wicked,</div>
                     <div class="line">like those that under hot ardent zeal would set</div>
                     <div class="line">whole realms on fire: Of such a nature is his</div>
                     <div class="line">politic love.</div>
                     <div class="line">This was my lord's best hope; now all are fled,</div>
                     <div class="line">Save only the gods: now his friends are dead,</div>
                     <div class="line">Doors, that were ne'er acquainted with their wards</div>
                     <div class="line">Many a bounteous year must be employ'd</div>
                     <div class="line">Now to guard sure their master.</div>
                     <div class="line">And this is all a liberal course allows;</div>
                     <div class="line">Who cannot keep his wealth must keep his house.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  The same. A hall in Timon's house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter two Servants of Varro, and the Servant of
LUCIUS, meeting TITUS, HORTENSIUS, and other
Servants of TIMON's creditors, waiting his coming out</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Varro's First Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Well met; good morrow, Titus and Hortensius.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TITUS</div>
                     <div class="line">The like to you kind Varro.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORTENSIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Lucius!</div>
                     <div class="line">What, do we meet together?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lucilius' Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, and I think</div>
                     <div class="line">One business does command us all; for mine Is money.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TITUS</div>
                     <div class="line">So is theirs and ours.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter PHILOTUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lucilius' Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">And Sir Philotus too!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHILOTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Good day at once.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lucilius' Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Welcome, good brother.</div>
                     <div class="line">What do you think the hour?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHILOTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Labouring for nine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lucilius' Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">So much?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHILOTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Is not my lord seen yet?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lucilius' Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Not yet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHILOTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I wonder on't; he was wont to shine at seven.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lucilius' Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, but the days are wax'd shorter with him:</div>
                     <div class="line">You must consider that a prodigal course</div>
                     <div class="line">Is like the sun's; but not, like his, recoverable.</div>
                     <div class="line">I fear 'tis deepest winter in Lord Timon's purse;</div>
                     <div class="line">That is one may reach deep enough, and yet</div>
                     <div class="line">Find little.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHILOTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I am of your fear for that.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TITUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll show you how to observe a strange event.</div>
                     <div class="line">Your lord sends now for money.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORTENSIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Most true, he does.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TITUS</div>
                     <div class="line">And he wears jewels now of Timon's gift,</div>
                     <div class="line">For which I wait for money.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORTENSIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">It is against my heart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lucilius' Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Mark, how strange it shows,</div>
                     <div class="line">Timon in this should pay more than he owes:</div>
                     <div class="line">And e'en as if your lord should wear rich jewels,</div>
                     <div class="line">And send for money for 'em.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORTENSIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I'm weary of this charge, the gods can witness:</div>
                     <div class="line">I know my lord hath spent of Timon's wealth,</div>
                     <div class="line">And now ingratitude makes it worse than stealth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Varro's First Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, mine's three thousand crowns: what's yours?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lucilius' Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Five thousand mine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Varro's First Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis much deep: and it should seem by the sun,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your master's confidence was above mine;</div>
                     <div class="line">Else, surely, his had equall'd.</div>
                     <div class="line">Enter FLAMINIUS.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TITUS</div>
                     <div class="line">One of Lord Timon's men.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lucilius' Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Flaminius! Sir, a word: pray, is my lord ready to</div>
                     <div class="line">come forth?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FLAMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">No, indeed, he is not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TITUS</div>
                     <div class="line">We attend his lordship; pray, signify so much.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FLAMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I need not tell him that; he knows you are too diligent.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <p>Enter FLAVIUS in a cloak, muffled</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lucilius' Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Ha! is not that his steward muffled so?</div>
                     <div class="line">He goes away in a cloud: call him, call him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TITUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you hear, sir?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Varro's Second Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">By your leave, sir,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FLAVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What do ye ask of me, my friend?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TITUS</div>
                     <div class="line">We wait for certain money here, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FLAVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay,</div>
                     <div class="line">If money were as certain as your waiting,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twere sure enough.</div>
                     <div class="line">Why then preferr'd you not your sums and bills,</div>
                     <div class="line">When your false masters eat of my lord's meat?</div>
                     <div class="line">Then they could smile and fawn upon his debts</div>
                     <div class="line">And take down the interest into their</div>
                     <div class="line">gluttonous maws.</div>
                     <div class="line">You do yourselves but wrong to stir me up;</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me pass quietly:</div>
                     <div class="line">Believe 't, my lord and I have made an end;</div>
                     <div class="line">I have no more to reckon, he to spend.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lucilius' Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, but this answer will not serve.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FLAVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">If 'twill not serve,'tis not so base as you;</div>
                     <div class="line">For you serve knaves.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Varro's First Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">How! what does his cashiered worship mutter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Varro's Second Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">No matter what; he's poor, and that's revenge</div>
                     <div class="line">enough. Who can speak broader than he that has no</div>
                     <div class="line">house to put his head in? such may rail against</div>
                     <div class="line">great buildings.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter SERVILIUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TITUS</div>
                     <div class="line">O, here's Servilius; now we shall know some answer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SERVILIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">If I might beseech you, gentlemen, to repair some</div>
                     <div class="line">other hour, I should derive much from't; for,</div>
                     <div class="line">take't of my soul, my lord leans wondrously to</div>
                     <div class="line">discontent: his comfortable temper has forsook him;</div>
                     <div class="line">he's much out of health, and keeps his chamber.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lucilius' Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Many do keep their chambers are not sick:</div>
                     <div class="line">And, if it be so far beyond his health,</div>
                     <div class="line">Methinks he should the sooner pay his debts,</div>
                     <div class="line">And make a clear way to the gods.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SERVILIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Good gods!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TITUS</div>
                     <div class="line">We cannot take this for answer, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FLAMINIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Within</span>  Servilius, help! My lord! my lord!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter TIMON, in a rage, FLAMINIUS following</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">What, are my doors opposed against my passage?</div>
                     <div class="line">Have I been ever free, and must my house</div>
                     <div class="line">Be my retentive enemy, my gaol?</div>
                     <div class="line">The place which I have feasted, does it now,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like all mankind, show me an iron heart?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lucilius' Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Put in now, Titus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TITUS</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, here is my bill.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lucilius' Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Here's mine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORTENSIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">And mine, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Both Varro's Servants</div>
                     <div class="line">And ours, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHILOTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">All our bills.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Knock me down with 'em: cleave me to the girdle.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lucilius' Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, my lord,-</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Cut my heart in sums.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TITUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Mine, fifty talents.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell out my blood.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lucilius' Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Five thousand crowns, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Five thousand drops pays that.</div>
                     <div class="line">What yours?--and yours?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Varro's First Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Varro's Second Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Tear me, take me, and the gods fall upon you!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HORTENSIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">'Faith, I perceive our masters may throw their caps</div>
                     <div class="line">at their money: these debts may well be called</div>
                     <div class="line">desperate ones, for a madman owes 'em.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
               <p>Re-enter TIMON and FLAVIUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">They have e'en put my breath from me, the slaves.</div>
                     <div class="line">Creditors? devils!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FLAVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">My dear lord,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">What if it should be so?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FLAVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll have it so. My steward!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FLAVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Here, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">So fitly? Go, bid all my friends again,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lucius, Lucullus, and Sempronius:</div>
                     <div class="line">All, sirrah, all:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll once more feast the rascals.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FLAVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">O my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">You only speak from your distracted soul;</div>
                     <div class="line">There is not so much left, to furnish out</div>
                     <div class="line">A moderate table.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Be't not in thy care; go,</div>
                     <div class="line">I charge thee, invite them all: let in the tide</div>
                     <div class="line">Of knaves once more; my cook and I'll provide.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.6">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>5. SCENE V.  The same. The senate-house. The Senate sitting.</h2>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, you have my voice to it; the fault's</div>
                     <div class="line">Bloody; 'tis necessary he should die:</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing emboldens sin so much as mercy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Most true; the law shall bruise him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ALCIBIADES, with Attendants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">Honour, health, and compassion to the senate!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, captain?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">I am an humble suitor to your virtues;</div>
                     <div class="line">For pity is the virtue of the law,</div>
                     <div class="line">And none but tyrants use it cruelly.</div>
                     <div class="line">It pleases time and fortune to lie heavy</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon a friend of mine, who, in hot blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath stepp'd into the law, which is past depth</div>
                     <div class="line">To those that, without heed, do plunge into 't.</div>
                     <div class="line">He is a man, setting his fate aside,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of comely virtues:</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor did he soil the fact with cowardice--</div>
                     <div class="line">An honour in him which buys out his fault--</div>
                     <div class="line">But with a noble fury and fair spirit,</div>
                     <div class="line">Seeing his reputation touch'd to death,</div>
                     <div class="line">He did oppose his foe:</div>
                     <div class="line">And with such sober and unnoted passion</div>
                     <div class="line">He did behave his anger, ere 'twas spent,</div>
                     <div class="line">As if he had but proved an argument.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">You undergo too strict a paradox,</div>
                     <div class="line">Striving to make an ugly deed look fair:</div>
                     <div class="line">Your words have took such pains as if they labour'd</div>
                     <div class="line">To bring manslaughter into form and set quarrelling</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon the head of valour; which indeed</div>
                     <div class="line">Is valour misbegot and came into the world</div>
                     <div class="line">When sects and factions were newly born:</div>
                     <div class="line">He's truly valiant that can wisely suffer</div>
                     <div class="line">The worst that man can breathe, and make his wrongs</div>
                     <div class="line">His outsides, to wear them like his raiment,</div>
                     <div class="line">carelessly,</div>
                     <div class="line">And ne'er prefer his injuries to his heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">To bring it into danger.</div>
                     <div class="line">If wrongs be evils and enforce us kill,</div>
                     <div class="line">What folly 'tis to hazard life for ill!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">You cannot make gross sins look clear:</div>
                     <div class="line">To revenge is no valour, but to bear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">My lords, then, under favour, pardon me,</div>
                     <div class="line">If I speak like a captain.</div>
                     <div class="line">Why do fond men expose themselves to battle,</div>
                     <div class="line">And not endure all threats? sleep upon't,</div>
                     <div class="line">And let the foes quietly cut their throats,</div>
                     <div class="line">Without repugnancy? If there be</div>
                     <div class="line">Such valour in the bearing, what make we</div>
                     <div class="line">Abroad? why then, women are more valiant</div>
                     <div class="line">That stay at home, if bearing carry it,</div>
                     <div class="line">And the ass more captain than the lion, the felon</div>
                     <div class="line">Loaden with irons wiser than the judge,</div>
                     <div class="line">If wisdom be in suffering. O my lords,</div>
                     <div class="line">As you are great, be pitifully good:</div>
                     <div class="line">Who cannot condemn rashness in cold blood?</div>
                     <div class="line">To kill, I grant, is sin's extremest gust;</div>
                     <div class="line">But, in defence, by mercy, 'tis most just.</div>
                     <div class="line">To be in anger is impiety;</div>
                     <div class="line">But who is man that is not angry?</div>
                     <div class="line">Weigh but the crime with this.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">You breathe in vain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">In vain! his service done</div>
                     <div class="line">At Lacedaemon and Byzantium</div>
                     <div class="line">Were a sufficient briber for his life.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">What's that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">I say, my lords, he has done fair service,</div>
                     <div class="line">And slain in fight many of your enemies:</div>
                     <div class="line">How full of valour did he bear himself</div>
                     <div class="line">In the last conflict, and made plenteous wounds!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">He has made too much plenty with 'em;</div>
                     <div class="line">He's a sworn rioter: he has a sin that often</div>
                     <div class="line">Drowns him, and takes his valour prisoner:</div>
                     <div class="line">If there were no foes, that were enough</div>
                     <div class="line">To overcome him: in that beastly fury</div>
                     <div class="line">He has been known to commit outrages,</div>
                     <div class="line">And cherish factions: 'tis inferr'd to us,</div>
                     <div class="line">His days are foul and his drink dangerous.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">He dies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">Hard fate! he might have died in war.</div>
                     <div class="line">My lords, if not for any parts in him--</div>
                     <div class="line">Though his right arm might purchase his own time</div>
                     <div class="line">And be in debt to none--yet, more to move you,</div>
                     <div class="line">Take my deserts to his, and join 'em both:</div>
                     <div class="line">And, for I know your reverend ages love</div>
                     <div class="line">Security, I'll pawn my victories, all</div>
                     <div class="line">My honours to you, upon his good returns.</div>
                     <div class="line">If by this crime he owes the law his life,</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, let the war receive 't in valiant gore</div>
                     <div class="line">For law is strict, and war is nothing more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">We are for law: he dies; urge it no more,</div>
                     <div class="line">On height of our displeasure: friend or brother,</div>
                     <div class="line">He forfeits his own blood that spills another.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">Must it be so? it must not be. My lords,</div>
                     <div class="line">I do beseech you, know me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">How!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">Call me to your remembrances.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">What!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot think but your age has forgot me;</div>
                     <div class="line">It could not else be, I should prove so base,</div>
                     <div class="line">To sue, and be denied such common grace:</div>
                     <div class="line">My wounds ache at you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you dare our anger?</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis in few words, but spacious in effect;</div>
                     <div class="line">We banish thee for ever.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">Banish me!</div>
                     <div class="line">Banish your dotage; banish usury,</div>
                     <div class="line">That makes the senate ugly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">If, after two days' shine, Athens contain thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">Attend our weightier judgment. And, not to swell</div>
                     <div class="line">our spirit,</div>
                     <div class="line">He shall be executed presently.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt Senators</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">Now the gods keep you old enough; that you may live</div>
                     <div class="line">Only in bone, that none may look on you!</div>
                     <div class="line">I'm worse than mad: I have kept back their foes,</div>
                     <div class="line">While they have told their money and let out</div>
                     <div class="line">Their coin upon large interest, I myself</div>
                     <div class="line">Rich only in large hurts. All those for this?</div>
                     <div class="line">Is this the balsam that the usuring senate</div>
                     <div class="line">Pours into captains' wounds? Banishment!</div>
                     <div class="line">It comes not ill; I hate not to be banish'd;</div>
                     <div class="line">It is a cause worthy my spleen and fury,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I may strike at Athens. I'll cheer up</div>
                     <div class="line">My discontented troops, and lay for hearts.</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis honour with most lands to be at odds;</div>
                     <div class="line">Soldiers should brook as little wrongs as gods.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.7">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>6. SCENE VI.  The same. A banqueting-room in Timon's house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Music. Tables set out: Servants attending.
Enter divers Lords, Senators and others, at
several doors</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">The good time of day to you, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">I also wish it to you. I think this honourable lord</div>
                     <div class="line">did but try us this other day.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon that were my thoughts tiring, when we</div>
                     <div class="line">encountered: I hope it is not so low with him as</div>
                     <div class="line">he made it seem in the trial of his several friends.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">It should not be, by the persuasion of his new feasting.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">I should think so: he hath sent me an earnest</div>
                     <div class="line">inviting, which many my near occasions did urge me</div>
                     <div class="line">to put off; but he hath conjured me beyond them, and</div>
                     <div class="line">I must needs appear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">In like manner was I in debt to my importunate</div>
                     <div class="line">business, but he would not hear my excuse. I am</div>
                     <div class="line">sorry, when he sent to borrow of me, that my</div>
                     <div class="line">provision was out.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">I am sick of that grief too, as I understand how all</div>
                     <div class="line">things go.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Every man here's so. What would he have borrowed of</div>
                     <div class="line">you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">A thousand pieces.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">A thousand pieces!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">What of you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">He sent to me, sir,--Here he comes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter TIMON and Attendants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">With all my heart, gentlemen both; and how fare you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Ever at the best, hearing well of your lordship.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">The swallow follows not summer more willing than we</div>
                     <div class="line">your lordship.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  Nor more willingly leaves winter; such</div>
                     <div class="line">summer-birds are men. Gentlemen, our dinner will not</div>
                     <div class="line">recompense this long stay: feast your ears with the</div>
                     <div class="line">music awhile, if they will fare so harshly o' the</div>
                     <div class="line">trumpet's sound; we shall to 't presently.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">I hope it remains not unkindly with your lordship</div>
                     <div class="line">that I returned you an empty messenger.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">O, sir, let it not trouble you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">My noble lord,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, my good friend, what cheer?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">My most honourable lord, I am e'en sick of shame,</div>
                     <div class="line">that, when your lordship this other day sent to me,</div>
                     <div class="line">I was so unfortunate a beggar.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Think not on 't, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">If you had sent but two hours before,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Let it not cumber your better remembrance.</div>
                     <p>The banquet brought in</p>
                     <div class="line">Come, bring in all together.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">All covered dishes!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Royal cheer, I warrant you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Doubt not that, if money and the season can yield</div>
                     <div class="line">it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">How do you? What's the news?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Alcibiades is banished: hear you of it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Alcibiades banished!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis so, be sure of it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">How! how!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray you, upon what?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">My worthy friends, will you draw near?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll tell you more anon. Here's a noble feast toward.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">This is the old man still.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Will 't hold? will 't hold?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">It does: but time will--and so--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">I do conceive.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Each man to his stool, with that spur as he would to</div>
                     <div class="line">the lip of his mistress: your diet shall be in all</div>
                     <div class="line">places alike. Make not a city feast of it, to let</div>
                     <div class="line">the meat cool ere we can agree upon the first place:</div>
                     <div class="line">sit, sit. The gods require our thanks.</div>
                     <div class="line">You great benefactors, sprinkle our society with</div>
                     <div class="line">thankfulness. For your own gifts, make yourselves</div>
                     <div class="line">praised: but reserve still to give, lest your</div>
                     <div class="line">deities be despised. Lend to each man enough, that</div>
                     <div class="line">one need not lend to another; for, were your</div>
                     <div class="line">godheads to borrow of men, men would forsake the</div>
                     <div class="line">gods. Make the meat be beloved more than the man</div>
                     <div class="line">that gives it. Let no assembly of twenty be without</div>
                     <div class="line">a score of villains: if there sit twelve women at</div>
                     <div class="line">the table, let a dozen of them be--as they are. The</div>
                     <div class="line">rest of your fees, O gods--the senators of Athens,</div>
                     <div class="line">together with the common lag of people--what is</div>
                     <div class="line">amiss in them, you gods, make suitable for</div>
                     <div class="line">destruction. For these my present friends, as they</div>
                     <div class="line">are to me nothing, so in nothing bless them, and to</div>
                     <div class="line">nothing are they welcome.</div>
                     <div class="line">Uncover, dogs, and lap.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>The dishes are uncovered and seen to be full of
warm water</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Some Speak</div>
                     <div class="line">What does his lordship mean?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Some Others</div>
                     <div class="line">I know not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">May you a better feast never behold,</div>
                     <div class="line">You knot of mouth-friends I smoke and lukewarm water</div>
                     <div class="line">Is your perfection. This is Timon's last;</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, stuck and spangled with your flatteries,</div>
                     <div class="line">Washes it off, and sprinkles in your faces</div>
                     <div class="line">Your reeking villany.</div>
                     <p>Throwing the water in their faces</p>
                     <div class="line">Live loathed and long,</div>
                     <div class="line">Most smiling, smooth, detested parasites,</div>
                     <div class="line">Courteous destroyers, affable wolves, meek bears,</div>
                     <div class="line">You fools of fortune, trencher-friends, time's flies,</div>
                     <div class="line">Cap and knee slaves, vapours, and minute-jacks!</div>
                     <div class="line">Of man and beast the infinite malady</div>
                     <div class="line">Crust you quite o'er! What, dost thou go?</div>
                     <div class="line">Soft! take thy physic first--thou too--and thou;--</div>
                     <div class="line">Stay, I will lend thee money, borrow none.</div>
                     <p>Throws the dishes at them, and drives them out</p>
                     <div class="line">What, all in motion? Henceforth be no feast,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whereat a villain's not a welcome guest.</div>
                     <div class="line">Burn, house! sink, Athens! henceforth hated be</div>
                     <div class="line">Of Timon man and all humanity!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <p>Re-enter the Lords, Senators, &c</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">How now, my lords!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Know you the quality of Lord Timon's fury?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Push! did you see my cap?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Fourth Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">I have lost my gown.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">He's but a mad lord, and nought but humour sways him.</div>
                     <div class="line">He gave me a jewel th' other day, and now he has</div>
                     <div class="line">beat it out of my hat: did you see my jewel?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Did you see my cap?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Here 'tis.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Fourth Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Here lies my gown.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Let's make no stay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord Timon's mad.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">I feel 't upon my bones.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Fourth Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">One day he gives us diamonds, next day stones.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.6">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 4. ACT IV</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.2">1. SCENE I.  Without the walls of Athens.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.3">2. SCENE II.  Athens. A room in Timon's house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.4">3. SCENE III.  Woods and cave, near the seashore.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  Without the walls of Athens.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter TIMON</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me look back upon thee. O thou wall,</div>
                     <div class="line">That girdlest in those wolves, dive in the earth,</div>
                     <div class="line">And fence not Athens! Matrons, turn incontinent!</div>
                     <div class="line">Obedience fail in children! slaves and fools,</div>
                     <div class="line">Pluck the grave wrinkled senate from the bench,</div>
                     <div class="line">And minister in their steads! to general filths</div>
                     <div class="line">Convert o' the instant, green virginity,</div>
                     <div class="line">Do 't in your parents' eyes! bankrupts, hold fast;</div>
                     <div class="line">Rather than render back, out with your knives,</div>
                     <div class="line">And cut your trusters' throats! bound servants, steal!</div>
                     <div class="line">Large-handed robbers your grave masters are,</div>
                     <div class="line">And pill by law. Maid, to thy master's bed;</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy mistress is o' the brothel! Son of sixteen,</div>
                     <div class="line">pluck the lined crutch from thy old limping sire,</div>
                     <div class="line">With it beat out his brains! Piety, and fear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Religion to the gods, peace, justice, truth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Domestic awe, night-rest, and neighbourhood,</div>
                     <div class="line">Instruction, manners, mysteries, and trades,</div>
                     <div class="line">Degrees, observances, customs, and laws,</div>
                     <div class="line">Decline to your confounding contraries,</div>
                     <div class="line">And let confusion live! Plagues, incident to men,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your potent and infectious fevers heap</div>
                     <div class="line">On Athens, ripe for stroke! Thou cold sciatica,</div>
                     <div class="line">Cripple our senators, that their limbs may halt</div>
                     <div class="line">As lamely as their manners. Lust and liberty</div>
                     <div class="line">Creep in the minds and marrows of our youth,</div>
                     <div class="line">That 'gainst the stream of virtue they may strive,</div>
                     <div class="line">And drown themselves in riot! Itches, blains,</div>
                     <div class="line">Sow all the Athenian bosoms; and their crop</div>
                     <div class="line">Be general leprosy! Breath infect breath,</div>
                     <div class="line">at their society, as their friendship, may</div>
                     <div class="line">merely poison! Nothing I'll bear from thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">But nakedness, thou detestable town!</div>
                     <div class="line">Take thou that too, with multiplying bans!</div>
                     <div class="line">Timon will to the woods; where he shall find</div>
                     <div class="line">The unkindest beast more kinder than mankind.</div>
                     <div class="line">The gods confound--hear me, you good gods all--</div>
                     <div class="line">The Athenians both within and out that wall!</div>
                     <div class="line">And grant, as Timon grows, his hate may grow</div>
                     <div class="line">To the whole race of mankind, high and low! Amen.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  Athens. A room in Timon's house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter FLAVIUS, with two or three Servants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Hear you, master steward, where's our master?</div>
                     <div class="line">Are we undone? cast off? nothing remaining?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FLAVIUS</div>
