                     <div class="line">Alack, my fellows, what should I say to you?</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me be recorded by the righteous gods,</div>
                     <div class="line">I am as poor as you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Such a house broke!</div>
                     <div class="line">So noble a master fall'n! All gone! and not</div>
                     <div class="line">One friend to take his fortune by the arm,</div>
                     <div class="line">And go along with him!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">As we do turn our backs</div>
                     <div class="line">From our companion thrown into his grave,</div>
                     <div class="line">So his familiars to his buried fortunes</div>
                     <div class="line">Slink all away, leave their false vows with him,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like empty purses pick'd; and his poor self,</div>
                     <div class="line">A dedicated beggar to the air,</div>
                     <div class="line">With his disease of all-shunn'd poverty,</div>
                     <div class="line">Walks, like contempt, alone. More of our fellows.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter other Servants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FLAVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">All broken implements of a ruin'd house.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet do our hearts wear Timon's livery;</div>
                     <div class="line">That see I by our faces; we are fellows still,</div>
                     <div class="line">Serving alike in sorrow: leak'd is our bark,</div>
                     <div class="line">And we, poor mates, stand on the dying deck,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hearing the surges threat: we must all part</div>
                     <div class="line">Into this sea of air.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FLAVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Good fellows all,</div>
                     <div class="line">The latest of my wealth I'll share amongst you.</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherever we shall meet, for Timon's sake,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let's yet be fellows; let's shake our heads, and say,</div>
                     <div class="line">As 'twere a knell unto our master's fortunes,</div>
                     <div class="line">'We have seen better days.' Let each take some;</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, put out all your hands. Not one word more:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus part we rich in sorrow, parting poor.</div>
                     <p>Servants embrace, and part several ways</p>
                     <div class="line">O, the fierce wretchedness that glory brings us!</div>
                     <div class="line">Who would not wish to be from wealth exempt,</div>
                     <div class="line">Since riches point to misery and contempt?</div>
                     <div class="line">Who would be so mock'd with glory? or to live</div>
                     <div class="line">But in a dream of friendship?</div>
                     <div class="line">To have his pomp and all what state compounds</div>
                     <div class="line">But only painted, like his varnish'd friends?</div>
                     <div class="line">Poor honest lord, brought low by his own heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">Undone by goodness! Strange, unusual blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">When man's worst sin is, he does too much good!</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, then, dares to be half so kind again?</div>
                     <div class="line">For bounty, that makes gods, does still mar men.</div>
                     <div class="line">My dearest lord, bless'd, to be most accursed,</div>
                     <div class="line">Rich, only to be wretched, thy great fortunes</div>
                     <div class="line">Are made thy chief afflictions. Alas, kind lord!</div>
                     <div class="line">He's flung in rage from this ingrateful seat</div>
                     <div class="line">Of monstrous friends, nor has he with him to</div>
                     <div class="line">Supply his life, or that which can command it.</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll follow and inquire him out:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll ever serve his mind with my best will;</div>
                     <div class="line">Whilst I have gold, I'll be his steward still.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  Woods and cave, near the seashore.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter TIMON, from the cave</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">O blessed breeding sun, draw from the earth</div>
                     <div class="line">Rotten humidity; below thy sister's orb</div>
                     <div class="line">Infect the air! Twinn'd brothers of one womb,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose procreation, residence, and birth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Scarce is dividant, touch them with several fortunes;</div>
                     <div class="line">The greater scorns the lesser: not nature,</div>
                     <div class="line">To whom all sores lay siege, can bear great fortune,</div>
                     <div class="line">But by contempt of nature.</div>
                     <div class="line">Raise me this beggar, and deny 't that lord;</div>
                     <div class="line">The senator shall bear contempt hereditary,</div>
                     <div class="line">The beggar native honour.</div>
                     <div class="line">It is the pasture lards the rother's sides,</div>
                     <div class="line">The want that makes him lean. Who dares, who dares,</div>
                     <div class="line">In purity of manhood stand upright,</div>
                     <div class="line">And say 'This man's a flatterer?' if one be,</div>
                     <div class="line">So are they all; for every grise of fortune</div>
                     <div class="line">Is smooth'd by that below: the learned pate</div>
                     <div class="line">Ducks to the golden fool: all is oblique;</div>
                     <div class="line">There's nothing level in our cursed natures,</div>
                     <div class="line">But direct villany. Therefore, be abhorr'd</div>
                     <div class="line">All feasts, societies, and throngs of men!</div>
                     <div class="line">His semblable, yea, himself, Timon disdains:</div>
                     <div class="line">Destruction fang mankind! Earth, yield me roots!</div>
                     <p>Digging</p>
                     <div class="line">Who seeks for better of thee, sauce his palate</div>
                     <div class="line">With thy most operant poison! What is here?</div>
                     <div class="line">Gold? yellow, glittering, precious gold? No, gods,</div>
                     <div class="line">I am no idle votarist: roots, you clear heavens!</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus much of this will make black white, foul fair,</div>
                     <div class="line">Wrong right, base noble, old young, coward valiant.</div>
                     <div class="line">Ha, you gods! why this? what this, you gods? Why, this</div>
                     <div class="line">Will lug your priests and servants from your sides,</div>
                     <div class="line">Pluck stout men's pillows from below their heads:</div>
                     <div class="line">This yellow slave</div>
                     <div class="line">Will knit and break religions, bless the accursed,</div>
                     <div class="line">Make the hoar leprosy adored, place thieves</div>
                     <div class="line">And give them title, knee and approbation</div>
                     <div class="line">With senators on the bench: this is it</div>
                     <div class="line">That makes the wappen'd widow wed again;</div>
                     <div class="line">She, whom the spital-house and ulcerous sores</div>
                     <div class="line">Would cast the gorge at, this embalms and spices</div>
                     <div class="line">To the April day again. Come, damned earth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou common whore of mankind, that put'st odds</div>
                     <div class="line">Among the route of nations, I will make thee</div>
                     <div class="line">Do thy right nature.</div>
                     <p>March afar off</p>
                     <div class="line">Ha! a drum? Thou'rt quick,</div>
                     <div class="line">But yet I'll bury thee: thou'lt go, strong thief,</div>
                     <div class="line">When gouty keepers of thee cannot stand.</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, stay thou out for earnest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Keeping some gold</p>
               <p>Enter ALCIBIADES, with drum and fife, in
warlike manner; PHRYNIA and TIMANDRA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">What art thou there? speak.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">A beast, as thou art. The canker gnaw thy heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">For showing me again the eyes of man!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">What is thy name? Is man so hateful to thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">That art thyself a man?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">I am Misanthropos, and hate mankind.</div>
                     <div class="line">For thy part, I do wish thou wert a dog,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I might love thee something.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">I know thee well;</div>
                     <div class="line">But in thy fortunes am unlearn'd and strange.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">I know thee too; and more than that I know thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">I not desire to know. Follow thy drum;</div>
                     <div class="line">With man's blood paint the ground, gules, gules:</div>
                     <div class="line">Religious canons, civil laws are cruel;</div>
                     <div class="line">Then what should war be? This fell whore of thine</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath in her more destruction than thy sword,</div>
                     <div class="line">For all her cherubim look.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHRYNIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy lips rot off!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">I will not kiss thee; then the rot returns</div>
                     <div class="line">To thine own lips again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">How came the noble Timon to this change?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">As the moon does, by wanting light to give:</div>
                     <div class="line">But then renew I could not, like the moon;</div>
                     <div class="line">There were no suns to borrow of.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">Noble Timon,</div>
                     <div class="line">What friendship may I do thee?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">None, but to</div>
                     <div class="line">Maintain my opinion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">What is it, Timon?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Promise me friendship, but perform none: if thou</div>
                     <div class="line">wilt not promise, the gods plague thee, for thou art</div>
                     <div class="line">a man! if thou dost perform, confound thee, for</div>
                     <div class="line">thou art a man!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">I have heard in some sort of thy miseries.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou saw'st them, when I had prosperity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">I see them now; then was a blessed time.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">As thine is now, held with a brace of harlots.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMANDRA</div>
                     <div class="line">Is this the Athenian minion, whom the world</div>
                     <div class="line">Voiced so regardfully?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Art thou Timandra?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMANDRA</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Be a whore still: they love thee not that use thee;</div>
                     <div class="line">Give them diseases, leaving with thee their lust.</div>
                     <div class="line">Make use of thy salt hours: season the slaves</div>
                     <div class="line">For tubs and baths; bring down rose-cheeked youth</div>
                     <div class="line">To the tub-fast and the diet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMANDRA</div>
                     <div class="line">Hang thee, monster!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">Pardon him, sweet Timandra; for his wits</div>
                     <div class="line">Are drown'd and lost in his calamities.</div>
                     <div class="line">I have but little gold of late, brave Timon,</div>
                     <div class="line">The want whereof doth daily make revolt</div>
                     <div class="line">In my penurious band: I have heard, and grieved,</div>
                     <div class="line">How cursed Athens, mindless of thy worth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Forgetting thy great deeds, when neighbour states,</div>
                     <div class="line">But for thy sword and fortune, trod upon them,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">I prithee, beat thy drum, and get thee gone.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">I am thy friend, and pity thee, dear Timon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">How dost thou pity him whom thou dost trouble?</div>
                     <div class="line">I had rather be alone.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, fare thee well:</div>
                     <div class="line">Here is some gold for thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Keep it, I cannot eat it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">When I have laid proud Athens on a heap,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Warr'st thou 'gainst Athens?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, Timon, and have cause.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">The gods confound them all in thy conquest;</div>
                     <div class="line">And thee after, when thou hast conquer'd!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">Why me, Timon?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">That, by killing of villains,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou wast born to conquer my country.</div>
                     <div class="line">Put up thy gold: go on,--here's gold,--go on;</div>
                     <div class="line">Be as a planetary plague, when Jove</div>
                     <div class="line">Will o'er some high-viced city hang his poison</div>
                     <div class="line">In the sick air: let not thy sword skip one:</div>
                     <div class="line">Pity not honour'd age for his white beard;</div>
                     <div class="line">He is an usurer: strike me the counterfeit matron;</div>
                     <div class="line">It is her habit only that is honest,</div>
                     <div class="line">Herself's a bawd: let not the virgin's cheek</div>
                     <div class="line">Make soft thy trenchant sword; for those milk-paps,</div>
                     <div class="line">That through the window-bars bore at men's eyes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Are not within the leaf of pity writ,</div>
                     <div class="line">But set them down horrible traitors: spare not the babe,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose dimpled smiles from fools exhaust their mercy;</div>
                     <div class="line">Think it a bastard, whom the oracle</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath doubtfully pronounced thy throat shall cut,</div>
                     <div class="line">And mince it sans remorse: swear against objects;</div>
                     <div class="line">Put armour on thine ears and on thine eyes;</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose proof, nor yells of mothers, maids, nor babes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor sight of priests in holy vestments bleeding,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall pierce a jot. There's gold to pay soldiers:</div>
                     <div class="line">Make large confusion; and, thy fury spent,</div>
                     <div class="line">Confounded be thyself! Speak not, be gone.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">Hast thou gold yet? I'll take the gold thou</div>
                     <div class="line">givest me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not all thy counsel.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Dost thou, or dost thou not, heaven's curse</div>
                     <div class="line">upon thee!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHRYNIA</div>
                     <div class="speaker">TIMANDRA</div>
                     <div class="line">Give us some gold, good Timon: hast thou more?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Enough to make a whore forswear her trade,</div>
                     <div class="line">And to make whores, a bawd. Hold up, you sluts,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your aprons mountant: you are not oathable,</div>
                     <div class="line">Although, I know, you 'll swear, terribly swear</div>
                     <div class="line">Into strong shudders and to heavenly agues</div>
                     <div class="line">The immortal gods that hear you,--spare your oaths,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll trust to your conditions: be whores still;</div>
                     <div class="line">And he whose pious breath seeks to convert you,</div>
                     <div class="line">Be strong in whore, allure him, burn him up;</div>
                     <div class="line">Let your close fire predominate his smoke,</div>
                     <div class="line">And be no turncoats: yet may your pains, six months,</div>
                     <div class="line">Be quite contrary: and thatch your poor thin roofs</div>
                     <div class="line">With burthens of the dead;--some that were hang'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">No matter:--wear them, betray with them: whore still;</div>
                     <div class="line">Paint till a horse may mire upon your face,</div>
                     <div class="line">A pox of wrinkles!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHRYNIA</div>
                     <div class="speaker">TIMANDRA</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, more gold: what then?</div>
                     <div class="line">Believe't, that we'll do any thing for gold.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Consumptions sow</div>
                     <div class="line">In hollow bones of man; strike their sharp shins,</div>
                     <div class="line">And mar men's spurring. Crack the lawyer's voice,</div>
                     <div class="line">That he may never more false title plead,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor sound his quillets shrilly: hoar the flamen,</div>
                     <div class="line">That scolds against the quality of flesh,</div>
                     <div class="line">And not believes himself: down with the nose,</div>
                     <div class="line">Down with it flat; take the bridge quite away</div>
                     <div class="line">Of him that, his particular to foresee,</div>
                     <div class="line">Smells from the general weal: make curl'd-pate</div>
                     <div class="line">ruffians bald;</div>
                     <div class="line">And let the unscarr'd braggarts of the war</div>
                     <div class="line">Derive some pain from you: plague all;</div>
                     <div class="line">That your activity may defeat and quell</div>
                     <div class="line">The source of all erection. There's more gold:</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you damn others, and let this damn you,</div>
                     <div class="line">And ditches grave you all!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PHRYNIA</div>
                     <div class="speaker">TIMANDRA</div>
                     <div class="line">More counsel with more money, bounteous Timon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">More whore, more mischief first; I have given you earnest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">Strike up the drum towards Athens! Farewell, Timon:</div>
                     <div class="line">If I thrive well, I'll visit thee again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">If I hope well, I'll never see thee more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">I never did thee harm.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, thou spokest well of me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">Call'st thou that harm?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Men daily find it. Get thee away, and take</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy beagles with thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">We but offend him. Strike!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Drum beats. Exeunt ALCIBIADES, PHRYNIA,
and TIMANDRA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">That nature, being sick of man's unkindness,</div>
                     <div class="line">Should yet be hungry! Common mother, thou,</div>
                     <p>Digging</p>
                     <div class="line">Whose womb unmeasurable, and infinite breast,</div>
                     <div class="line">Teems, and feeds all; whose self-same mettle,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whereof thy proud child, arrogant man, is puff'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Engenders the black toad and adder blue,</div>
                     <div class="line">The gilded newt and eyeless venom'd worm,</div>
                     <div class="line">With all the abhorred births below crisp heaven</div>
                     <div class="line">Whereon Hyperion's quickening fire doth shine;</div>
                     <div class="line">Yield him, who all thy human sons doth hate,</div>
                     <div class="line">From forth thy plenteous bosom, one poor root!</div>
                     <div class="line">Ensear thy fertile and conceptious womb,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let it no more bring out ingrateful man!</div>
                     <div class="line">Go great with tigers, dragons, wolves, and bears;</div>
                     <div class="line">Teem with new monsters, whom thy upward face</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath to the marbled mansion all above</div>
                     <div class="line">Never presented!--O, a root,--dear thanks!--</div>
                     <div class="line">Dry up thy marrows, vines, and plough-torn leas;</div>
                     <div class="line">Whereof ungrateful man, with liquorish draughts</div>
                     <div class="line">And morsels unctuous, greases his pure mind,</div>
                     <div class="line">That from it all consideration slips!</div>
                     <p>Enter APEMANTUS</p>
                     <div class="line">More man? plague, plague!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I was directed hither: men report</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou dost affect my manners, and dost use them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis, then, because thou dost not keep a dog,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom I would imitate: consumption catch thee!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">This is in thee a nature but infected;</div>
                     <div class="line">A poor unmanly melancholy sprung</div>
                     <div class="line">From change of fortune. Why this spade? this place?</div>
                     <div class="line">This slave-like habit? and these looks of care?</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy flatterers yet wear silk, drink wine, lie soft;</div>
                     <div class="line">Hug their diseased perfumes, and have forgot</div>
                     <div class="line">That ever Timon was. Shame not these woods,</div>
                     <div class="line">By putting on the cunning of a carper.</div>
                     <div class="line">Be thou a flatterer now, and seek to thrive</div>
                     <div class="line">By that which has undone thee: hinge thy knee,</div>
                     <div class="line">And let his very breath, whom thou'lt observe,</div>
                     <div class="line">Blow off thy cap; praise his most vicious strain,</div>
                     <div class="line">And call it excellent: thou wast told thus;</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou gavest thine ears like tapsters that bid welcome</div>
                     <div class="line">To knaves and all approachers: 'tis most just</div>
                     <div class="line">That thou turn rascal; hadst thou wealth again,</div>
                     <div class="line">Rascals should have 't. Do not assume my likeness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Were I like thee, I'ld throw away myself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hast cast away thyself, being like thyself;</div>
                     <div class="line">A madman so long, now a fool. What, think'st</div>
                     <div class="line">That the bleak air, thy boisterous chamberlain,</div>
                     <div class="line">Will put thy shirt on warm? will these moss'd trees,</div>
                     <div class="line">That have outlived the eagle, page thy heels,</div>
                     <div class="line">And skip where thou point'st out? will the</div>
                     <div class="line">cold brook,</div>
                     <div class="line">Candied with ice, caudle thy morning taste,</div>
                     <div class="line">To cure thy o'er-night's surfeit? Call the creatures</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose naked natures live in an the spite</div>
                     <div class="line">Of wreakful heaven, whose bare unhoused trunks,</div>
                     <div class="line">To the conflicting elements exposed,</div>
                     <div class="line">Answer mere nature; bid them flatter thee;</div>
                     <div class="line">O, thou shalt find--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">A fool of thee: depart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I love thee better now than e'er I did.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">I hate thee worse.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Why?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou flatter'st misery.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I flatter not; but say thou art a caitiff.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Why dost thou seek me out?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">To vex thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Always a villain's office or a fool's.</div>
                     <div class="line">Dost please thyself in't?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">What! a knave too?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">If thou didst put this sour-cold habit on</div>
                     <div class="line">To castigate thy pride, 'twere well: but thou</div>
                     <div class="line">Dost it enforcedly; thou'ldst courtier be again,</div>
                     <div class="line">Wert thou not beggar. Willing misery</div>
                     <div class="line">Outlives encertain pomp, is crown'd before:</div>
                     <div class="line">The one is filling still, never complete;</div>
                     <div class="line">The other, at high wish: best state, contentless,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath a distracted and most wretched being,</div>
                     <div class="line">Worse than the worst, content.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou shouldst desire to die, being miserable.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Not by his breath that is more miserable.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art a slave, whom Fortune's tender arm</div>
                     <div class="line">With favour never clasp'd; but bred a dog.</div>
                     <div class="line">Hadst thou, like us from our first swath, proceeded</div>
                     <div class="line">The sweet degrees that this brief world affords</div>
                     <div class="line">To such as may the passive drugs of it</div>
                     <div class="line">Freely command, thou wouldst have plunged thyself</div>
                     <div class="line">In general riot; melted down thy youth</div>
                     <div class="line">In different beds of lust; and never learn'd</div>
                     <div class="line">The icy precepts of respect, but follow'd</div>
                     <div class="line">The sugar'd game before thee. But myself,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who had the world as my confectionary,</div>
                     <div class="line">The mouths, the tongues, the eyes and hearts of men</div>
                     <div class="line">At duty, more than I could frame employment,</div>
                     <div class="line">That numberless upon me stuck as leaves</div>
                     <div class="line">Do on the oak, hive with one winter's brush</div>
                     <div class="line">Fell from their boughs and left me open, bare</div>
                     <div class="line">For every storm that blows: I, to bear this,</div>
                     <div class="line">That never knew but better, is some burden:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy nature did commence in sufferance, time</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath made thee hard in't. Why shouldst thou hate men?</div>
                     <div class="line">They never flatter'd thee: what hast thou given?</div>
                     <div class="line">If thou wilt curse, thy father, that poor rag,</div>
                     <div class="line">Must be thy subject, who in spite put stuff</div>
                     <div class="line">To some she beggar and compounded thee</div>
                     <div class="line">Poor rogue hereditary. Hence, be gone!</div>
                     <div class="line">If thou hadst not been born the worst of men,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hadst been a knave and flatterer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Art thou proud yet?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, that I am not thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I, that I was</div>
                     <div class="line">No prodigal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">I, that I am one now:</div>
                     <div class="line">Were all the wealth I have shut up in thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'ld give thee leave to hang it. Get thee gone.</div>
                     <div class="line">That the whole life of Athens were in this!</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus would I eat it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Eating a root</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Here; I will mend thy feast.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Offering him a root</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">First mend my company, take away thyself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">So I shall mend mine own, by the lack of thine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis not well mended so, it is but botch'd;</div>
                     <div class="line">if not, I would it were.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What wouldst thou have to Athens?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Thee thither in a whirlwind. If thou wilt,</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell them there I have gold; look, so I have.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Here is no use for gold.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">The best and truest;</div>
                     <div class="line">For here it sleeps, and does no hired harm.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Where liest o' nights, Timon?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Under that's above me.</div>
                     <div class="line">Where feed'st thou o' days, Apemantus?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Where my stomach finds meat; or, rather, where I eat</div>
                     <div class="line">it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Would poison were obedient and knew my mind!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Where wouldst thou send it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">To sauce thy dishes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">The middle of humanity thou never knewest, but the</div>
                     <div class="line">extremity of both ends: when thou wast in thy gilt</div>
                     <div class="line">and thy perfume, they mocked thee for too much</div>
                     <div class="line">curiosity; in thy rags thou knowest none, but art</div>
                     <div class="line">despised for the contrary. There's a medlar for</div>
                     <div class="line">thee, eat it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">On what I hate I feed not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Dost hate a medlar?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, though it look like thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">An thou hadst hated meddlers sooner, thou shouldst</div>
                     <div class="line">have loved thyself better now. What man didst thou</div>
                     <div class="line">ever know unthrift that was beloved after his means?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, without those means thou talkest of, didst thou</div>
                     <div class="line">ever know beloved?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Myself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">I understand thee; thou hadst some means to keep a</div>
                     <div class="line">dog.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What things in the world canst thou nearest compare</div>
                     <div class="line">to thy flatterers?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Women nearest; but men, men are the things</div>
                     <div class="line">themselves. What wouldst thou do with the world,</div>
                     <div class="line">Apemantus, if it lay in thy power?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Give it the beasts, to be rid of the men.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Wouldst thou have thyself fall in the confusion of</div>
                     <div class="line">men, and remain a beast with the beasts?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, Timon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">A beastly ambition, which the gods grant thee t'</div>
                     <div class="line">attain to! If thou wert the lion, the fox would</div>
                     <div class="line">beguile thee; if thou wert the lamb, the fox would</div>
                     <div class="line">eat three: if thou wert the fox, the lion would</div>
                     <div class="line">suspect thee, when peradventure thou wert accused by</div>
                     <div class="line">the ass: if thou wert the ass, thy dulness would</div>
                     <div class="line">torment thee, and still thou livedst but as a</div>
                     <div class="line">breakfast to the wolf: if thou wert the wolf, thy</div>
                     <div class="line">greediness would afflict thee, and oft thou shouldst</div>
                     <div class="line">hazard thy life for thy dinner: wert thou the</div>
                     <div class="line">unicorn, pride and wrath would confound thee and</div>
                     <div class="line">make thine own self the conquest of thy fury: wert</div>
                     <div class="line">thou a bear, thou wouldst be killed by the horse:</div>
                     <div class="line">wert thou a horse, thou wouldst be seized by the</div>
                     <div class="line">leopard: wert thou a leopard, thou wert german to</div>
                     <div class="line">the lion and the spots of thy kindred were jurors on</div>
                     <div class="line">thy life: all thy safety were remotion and thy</div>
                     <div class="line">defence absence. What beast couldst thou be, that</div>
                     <div class="line">were not subject to a beast? and what a beast art</div>
                     <div class="line">thou already, that seest not thy loss in</div>
                     <div class="line">transformation!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">If thou couldst please me with speaking to me, thou</div>
                     <div class="line">mightst have hit upon it here: the commonwealth of</div>
                     <div class="line">Athens is become a forest of beasts.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">How has the ass broke the wall, that thou art out of the city?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Yonder comes a poet and a painter: the plague of</div>
                     <div class="line">company light upon thee! I will fear to catch it</div>
                     <div class="line">and give way: when I know not what else to do, I'll</div>
                     <div class="line">see thee again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">When there is nothing living but thee, thou shalt be</div>
                     <div class="line">welcome. I had rather be a beggar's dog than Apemantus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art the cap of all the fools alive.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Would thou wert clean enough to spit upon!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">A plague on thee! thou art too bad to curse.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">All villains that do stand by thee are pure.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">There is no leprosy but what thou speak'st.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">If I name thee.</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll beat thee, but I should infect my hands.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I would my tongue could rot them off!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Away, thou issue of a mangy dog!</div>
                     <div class="line">Choler does kill me that thou art alive;</div>
                     <div class="line">I swound to see thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Would thou wouldst burst!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Away,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou tedious rogue! I am sorry I shall lose</div>
                     <div class="line">A stone by thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Throws a stone at him</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Beast!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Slave!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Toad!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Rogue, rogue, rogue!</div>
                     <div class="line">I am sick of this false world, and will love nought</div>
                     <div class="line">But even the mere necessities upon 't.</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, Timon, presently prepare thy grave;</div>
                     <div class="line">Lie where the light foam the sea may beat</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy grave-stone daily: make thine epitaph,</div>
                     <div class="line">That death in me at others' lives may laugh.</div>
                     <p>To the gold</p>
                     <div class="line">O thou sweet king-killer, and dear divorce</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twixt natural son and sire! thou bright defiler</div>
                     <div class="line">Of Hymen's purest bed! thou valiant Mars!</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou ever young, fresh, loved and delicate wooer,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose blush doth thaw the consecrated snow</div>
                     <div class="line">That lies on Dian's lap! thou visible god,</div>
                     <div class="line">That solder'st close impossibilities,</div>
                     <div class="line">And makest them kiss! that speak'st with</div>
                     <div class="line">every tongue,</div>
                     <div class="line">To every purpose! O thou touch of hearts!</div>
                     <div class="line">Think, thy slave man rebels, and by thy virtue</div>
                     <div class="line">Set them into confounding odds, that beasts</div>
                     <div class="line">May have the world in empire!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Would 'twere so!</div>
                     <div class="line">But not till I am dead. I'll say thou'st gold:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou wilt be throng'd to shortly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Throng'd to!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy back, I prithee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">APEMANTUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Live, and love thy misery.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Long live so, and so die.</div>
                     <p>Exit APEMANTUS</p>
                     <div class="line">I am quit.</div>
                     <div class="line">Moe things like men! Eat, Timon, and abhor them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Banditti</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Bandit</div>
                     <div class="line">Where should he have this gold? It is some poor</div>
                     <div class="line">fragment, some slender sort of his remainder: the</div>
                     <div class="line">mere want of gold, and the falling-from of his</div>
                     <div class="line">friends, drove him into this melancholy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Bandit</div>
                     <div class="line">It is noised he hath a mass of treasure.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Bandit</div>
                     <div class="line">Let us make the assay upon him: if he care not</div>
                     <div class="line">for't, he will supply us easily; if he covetously</div>
                     <div class="line">reserve it, how shall's get it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Bandit</div>
                     <div class="line">True; for he bears it not about him, 'tis hid.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Bandit</div>
                     <div class="line">Is not this he?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Banditti</div>
                     <div class="line">Where?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Bandit</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis his description.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Bandit</div>
                     <div class="line">He; I know him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Banditti</div>
                     <div class="line">Save thee, Timon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, thieves?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Banditti</div>
                     <div class="line">Soldiers, not thieves.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Both too; and women's sons.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Banditti</div>
                     <div class="line">We are not thieves, but men that much do want.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Your greatest want is, you want much of meat.</div>
                     <div class="line">Why should you want? Behold, the earth hath roots;</div>
                     <div class="line">Within this mile break forth a hundred springs;</div>
                     <div class="line">The oaks bear mast, the briers scarlet hips;</div>
                     <div class="line">The bounteous housewife, nature, on each bush</div>
                     <div class="line">Lays her full mess before you. Want! why want?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Bandit</div>
                     <div class="line">We cannot live on grass, on berries, water,</div>
                     <div class="line">As beasts and birds and fishes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor on the beasts themselves, the birds, and fishes;</div>
                     <div class="line">You must eat men. Yet thanks I must you con</div>
                     <div class="line">That you are thieves profess'd, that you work not</div>
                     <div class="line">In holier shapes: for there is boundless theft</div>
                     <div class="line">In limited professions. Rascal thieves,</div>
                     <div class="line">Here's gold. Go, suck the subtle blood o' the grape,</div>
                     <div class="line">Till the high fever seethe your blood to froth,</div>
                     <div class="line">And so 'scape hanging: trust not the physician;</div>
                     <div class="line">His antidotes are poison, and he slays</div>
                     <div class="line">Moe than you rob: take wealth and lives together;</div>
                     <div class="line">Do villany, do, since you protest to do't,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like workmen. I'll example you with thievery.</div>
                     <div class="line">The sun's a thief, and with his great attraction</div>
                     <div class="line">Robs the vast sea: the moon's an arrant thief,</div>
                     <div class="line">And her pale fire she snatches from the sun:</div>
                     <div class="line">The sea's a thief, whose liquid surge resolves</div>
                     <div class="line">The moon into salt tears: the earth's a thief,</div>
                     <div class="line">That feeds and breeds by a composture stolen</div>
                     <div class="line">From general excrement: each thing's a thief:</div>
                     <div class="line">The laws, your curb and whip, in their rough power</div>
                     <div class="line">Have uncheque'd theft. Love not yourselves: away,</div>
                     <div class="line">Rob one another. There's more gold. Cut throats:</div>
                     <div class="line">All that you meet are thieves: to Athens go,</div>
                     <div class="line">Break open shops; nothing can you steal,</div>
                     <div class="line">But thieves do lose it: steal no less for this</div>
                     <div class="line">I give you; and gold confound you howsoe'er! Amen.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Bandit</div>
                     <div class="line">Has almost charmed me from my profession, by</div>
                     <div class="line">persuading me to it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Bandit</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis in the malice of mankind that he thus advises</div>
                     <div class="line">us; not to have us thrive in our mystery.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Bandit</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll believe him as an enemy, and give over my trade.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Bandit</div>
                     <div class="line">Let us first see peace in Athens: there is no time</div>
                     <div class="line">so miserable but a man may be true.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt Banditti</p>
               <p>Enter FLAVIUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FLAVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">O you gods!</div>
                     <div class="line">Is yond despised and ruinous man my lord?</div>
                     <div class="line">Full of decay and failing? O monument</div>
                     <div class="line">And wonder of good deeds evilly bestow'd!</div>
                     <div class="line">What an alteration of honour</div>
                     <div class="line">Has desperate want made!</div>
                     <div class="line">What viler thing upon the earth than friends</div>
                     <div class="line">Who can bring noblest minds to basest ends!</div>
                     <div class="line">How rarely does it meet with this time's guise,</div>
                     <div class="line">When man was wish'd to love his enemies!</div>
                     <div class="line">Grant I may ever love, and rather woo</div>
                     <div class="line">Those that would mischief me than those that do!</div>
                     <div class="line">Has caught me in his eye: I will present</div>
                     <div class="line">My honest grief unto him; and, as my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">Still serve him with my life. My dearest master!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Away! what art thou?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FLAVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Have you forgot me, sir?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Why dost ask that? I have forgot all men;</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, if thou grant'st thou'rt a man, I have forgot thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FLAVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">An honest poor servant of yours.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Then I know thee not:</div>
                     <div class="line">I never had honest man about me, I; all</div>
                     <div class="line">I kept were knaves, to serve in meat to villains.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FLAVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">The gods are witness,</div>
                     <div class="line">Ne'er did poor steward wear a truer grief</div>
                     <div class="line">For his undone lord than mine eyes for you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">What, dost thou weep? Come nearer. Then I</div>
                     <div class="line">love thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because thou art a woman, and disclaim'st</div>
                     <div class="line">Flinty mankind; whose eyes do never give</div>
                     <div class="line">But thorough lust and laughter. Pity's sleeping:</div>
                     <div class="line">Strange times, that weep with laughing, not with weeping!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FLAVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I beg of you to know me, good my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">To accept my grief and whilst this poor wealth lasts</div>
                     <div class="line">To entertain me as your steward still.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Had I a steward</div>
