                     <div class="line">So true, so just, and now so comfortable?</div>
                     <div class="line">It almost turns my dangerous nature mild.</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me behold thy face. Surely, this man</div>
                     <div class="line">Was born of woman.</div>
                     <div class="line">Forgive my general and exceptless rashness,</div>
                     <div class="line">You perpetual-sober gods! I do proclaim</div>
                     <div class="line">One honest man--mistake me not--but one;</div>
                     <div class="line">No more, I pray,--and he's a steward.</div>
                     <div class="line">How fain would I have hated all mankind!</div>
                     <div class="line">And thou redeem'st thyself: but all, save thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">I fell with curses.</div>
                     <div class="line">Methinks thou art more honest now than wise;</div>
                     <div class="line">For, by oppressing and betraying me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou mightst have sooner got another service:</div>
                     <div class="line">For many so arrive at second masters,</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon their first lord's neck. But tell me true--</div>
                     <div class="line">For I must ever doubt, though ne'er so sure--</div>
                     <div class="line">Is not thy kindness subtle, covetous,</div>
                     <div class="line">If not a usuring kindness, and, as rich men deal gifts,</div>
                     <div class="line">Expecting in return twenty for one?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FLAVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">No, my most worthy master; in whose breast</div>
                     <div class="line">Doubt and suspect, alas, are placed too late:</div>
                     <div class="line">You should have fear'd false times when you did feast:</div>
                     <div class="line">Suspect still comes where an estate is least.</div>
                     <div class="line">That which I show, heaven knows, is merely love,</div>
                     <div class="line">Duty and zeal to your unmatched mind,</div>
                     <div class="line">Care of your food and living; and, believe it,</div>
                     <div class="line">My most honour'd lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">For any benefit that points to me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Either in hope or present, I'ld exchange</div>
                     <div class="line">For this one wish, that you had power and wealth</div>
                     <div class="line">To requite me, by making rich yourself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Look thee, 'tis so! Thou singly honest man,</div>
                     <div class="line">Here, take: the gods out of my misery</div>
                     <div class="line">Have sent thee treasure. Go, live rich and happy;</div>
                     <div class="line">But thus condition'd: thou shalt build from men;</div>
                     <div class="line">Hate all, curse all, show charity to none,</div>
                     <div class="line">But let the famish'd flesh slide from the bone,</div>
                     <div class="line">Ere thou relieve the beggar; give to dogs</div>
                     <div class="line">What thou deny'st to men; let prisons swallow 'em,</div>
                     <div class="line">Debts wither 'em to nothing; be men like</div>
                     <div class="line">blasted woods,</div>
                     <div class="line">And may diseases lick up their false bloods!</div>
                     <div class="line">And so farewell and thrive.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FLAVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">O, let me stay,</div>
                     <div class="line">And comfort you, my master.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">If thou hatest curses,</div>
                     <div class="line">Stay not; fly, whilst thou art blest and free:</div>
                     <div class="line">Ne'er see thou man, and let me ne'er see thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit FLAVIUS. TIMON retires to his cave</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.7">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 5. ACT V</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.3">2. SCENE II.  Before the walls of Athens.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.4">3. SCENE III.  The woods. Timon's cave, and a rude tomb seen.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.5">4. SCENE IV.  Before the walls of Athens.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  The woods. Before Timon's cave.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Poet and Painter; TIMON watching
them from his cave</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Painter</div>
                     <div class="line">As I took note of the place, it cannot be far where</div>
                     <div class="line">he abides.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Poet</div>
                     <div class="line">What's to be thought of him? does the rumour hold</div>
                     <div class="line">for true, that he's so full of gold?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Painter</div>
                     <div class="line">Certain: Alcibiades reports it; Phrynia and</div>
                     <div class="line">Timandra had gold of him: he likewise enriched poor</div>
                     <div class="line">straggling soldiers with great quantity: 'tis said</div>
                     <div class="line">he gave unto his steward a mighty sum.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Poet</div>
                     <div class="line">Then this breaking of his has been but a try for his friends.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Painter</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing else: you shall see him a palm in Athens</div>
                     <div class="line">again, and flourish with the highest. Therefore</div>
                     <div class="line">'tis not amiss we tender our loves to him, in this</div>
                     <div class="line">supposed distress of his: it will show honestly in</div>
                     <div class="line">us; and is very likely to load our purposes with</div>
                     <div class="line">what they travail for, if it be a just true report</div>
                     <div class="line">that goes of his having.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Poet</div>
                     <div class="line">What have you now to present unto him?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Painter</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing at this time but my visitation: only I will</div>
                     <div class="line">promise him an excellent piece.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Poet</div>
                     <div class="line">I must serve him so too, tell him of an intent</div>
                     <div class="line">that's coming toward him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Painter</div>
                     <div class="line">Good as the best. Promising is the very air o' the</div>
                     <div class="line">time: it opens the eyes of expectation:</div>
                     <div class="line">performance is ever the duller for his act; and,</div>
                     <div class="line">but in the plainer and simpler kind of people, the</div>
                     <div class="line">deed of saying is quite out of use. To promise is</div>
                     <div class="line">most courtly and fashionable: performance is a kind</div>
                     <div class="line">of will or testament which argues a great sickness</div>
                     <div class="line">in his judgment that makes it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>TIMON comes from his cave, behind</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  Excellent workman! thou canst not paint a</div>
                     <div class="line">man so bad as is thyself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Poet</div>
                     <div class="line">I am thinking what I shall say I have provided for</div>
                     <div class="line">him: it must be a personating of himself; a satire</div>
                     <div class="line">against the softness of prosperity, with a discovery</div>
                     <div class="line">of the infinite flatteries that follow youth and opulency.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  Must thou needs stand for a villain in</div>
                     <div class="line">thine own work? wilt thou whip thine own faults in</div>
                     <div class="line">other men? Do so, I have gold for thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Poet</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, let's seek him:</div>
                     <div class="line">Then do we sin against our own estate,</div>
                     <div class="line">When we may profit meet, and come too late.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Painter</div>
                     <div class="line">True;</div>
                     <div class="line">When the day serves, before black-corner'd night,</div>
                     <div class="line">Find what thou want'st by free and offer'd light. Come.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  I'll meet you at the turn. What a</div>
                     <div class="line">god's gold,</div>
                     <div class="line">That he is worshipp'd in a baser temple</div>
                     <div class="line">Than where swine feed!</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis thou that rigg'st the bark and plough'st the foam,</div>
                     <div class="line">Settlest admired reverence in a slave:</div>
                     <div class="line">To thee be worship! and thy saints for aye</div>
                     <div class="line">Be crown'd with plagues that thee alone obey!</div>
                     <div class="line">Fit I meet them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Coming forward</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Poet</div>
                     <div class="line">Hail, worthy Timon!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Painter</div>
                     <div class="line">Our late noble master!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Have I once lived to see two honest men?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Poet</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">Having often of your open bounty tasted,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hearing you were retired, your friends fall'n off,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose thankless natures--O abhorred spirits!--</div>
                     <div class="line">Not all the whips of heaven are large enough:</div>
                     <div class="line">What! to you,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose star-like nobleness gave life and influence</div>
                     <div class="line">To their whole being! I am rapt and cannot cover</div>
                     <div class="line">The monstrous bulk of this ingratitude</div>
                     <div class="line">With any size of words.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Let it go naked, men may see't the better:</div>
                     <div class="line">You that are honest, by being what you are,</div>
                     <div class="line">Make them best seen and known.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Painter</div>
                     <div class="line">He and myself</div>
                     <div class="line">Have travail'd in the great shower of your gifts,</div>
                     <div class="line">And sweetly felt it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, you are honest men.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Painter</div>
                     <div class="line">We are hither come to offer you our service.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Most honest men! Why, how shall I requite you?</div>
                     <div class="line">Can you eat roots, and drink cold water? no.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Both</div>
                     <div class="line">What we can do, we'll do, to do you service.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Ye're honest men: ye've heard that I have gold;</div>
                     <div class="line">I am sure you have: speak truth; ye're honest men.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Painter</div>
                     <div class="line">So it is said, my noble lord; but therefore</div>
                     <div class="line">Came not my friend nor I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Good honest men! Thou draw'st a counterfeit</div>
                     <div class="line">Best in all Athens: thou'rt, indeed, the best;</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou counterfeit'st most lively.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Painter</div>
                     <div class="line">So, so, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">E'en so, sir, as I say. And, for thy fiction,</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, thy verse swells with stuff so fine and smooth</div>
                     <div class="line">That thou art even natural in thine art.</div>
                     <div class="line">But, for all this, my honest-natured friends,</div>
                     <div class="line">I must needs say you have a little fault:</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, 'tis not monstrous in you, neither wish I</div>
                     <div class="line">You take much pains to mend.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Both</div>
                     <div class="line">Beseech your honour</div>
                     <div class="line">To make it known to us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">You'll take it ill.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Both</div>
                     <div class="line">Most thankfully, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you, indeed?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Both</div>
                     <div class="line">Doubt it not, worthy lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">There's never a one of you but trusts a knave,</div>
                     <div class="line">That mightily deceives you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Both</div>
                     <div class="line">Do we, my lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, and you hear him cog, see him dissemble,</div>
                     <div class="line">Know his gross patchery, love him, feed him,</div>
                     <div class="line">Keep in your bosom: yet remain assured</div>
                     <div class="line">That he's a made-up villain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Painter</div>
                     <div class="line">I know none such, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Poet</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Look you, I love you well; I'll give you gold,</div>
                     <div class="line">Rid me these villains from your companies:</div>
                     <div class="line">Hang them or stab them, drown them in a draught,</div>
                     <div class="line">Confound them by some course, and come to me,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll give you gold enough.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Both</div>
                     <div class="line">Name them, my lord, let's know them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">You that way and you this, but two in company;</div>
                     <div class="line">Each man apart, all single and alone,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet an arch-villain keeps him company.</div>
                     <div class="line">If where thou art two villains shall not be,</div>
                     <div class="line">Come not near him. If thou wouldst not reside</div>
                     <div class="line">But where one villain is, then him abandon.</div>
                     <div class="line">Hence, pack! there's gold; you came for gold, ye slaves:</div>
                     <p>To Painter</p>
                     <div class="line">You have work'd for me; there's payment for you: hence!</div>
                     <p>To Poet</p>
                     <div class="line">You are an alchemist; make gold of that.</div>
                     <div class="line">Out, rascal dogs!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Beats them out, and then retires to his cave</p>
               <p>Enter FLAVIUS and two Senators</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FLAVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">It is in vain that you would speak with Timon;</div>
                     <div class="line">For he is set so only to himself</div>
                     <div class="line">That nothing but himself which looks like man</div>
                     <div class="line">Is friendly with him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Bring us to his cave:</div>
                     <div class="line">It is our part and promise to the Athenians</div>
                     <div class="line">To speak with Timon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">At all times alike</div>
                     <div class="line">Men are not still the same: 'twas time and griefs</div>
                     <div class="line">That framed him thus: time, with his fairer hand,</div>
                     <div class="line">Offering the fortunes of his former days,</div>
                     <div class="line">The former man may make him. Bring us to him,</div>
                     <div class="line">And chance it as it may.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FLAVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Here is his cave.</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace and content be here! Lord Timon! Timon!</div>
                     <div class="line">Look out, and speak to friends: the Athenians,</div>
                     <div class="line">By two of their most reverend senate, greet thee:</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak to them, noble Timon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>TIMON comes from his cave</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou sun, that comfort'st, burn! Speak, and</div>
                     <div class="line">be hang'd:</div>
                     <div class="line">For each true word, a blister! and each false</div>
                     <div class="line">Be as cauterizing to the root o' the tongue,</div>
                     <div class="line">Consuming it with speaking!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Worthy Timon,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Of none but such as you, and you of Timon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">The senators of Athens greet thee, Timon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank them; and would send them back the plague,</div>
                     <div class="line">Could I but catch it for them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">O, forget</div>
                     <div class="line">What we are sorry for ourselves in thee.</div>
                     <div class="line">The senators with one consent of love</div>
                     <div class="line">Entreat thee back to Athens; who have thought</div>
                     <div class="line">On special dignities, which vacant lie</div>
                     <div class="line">For thy best use and wearing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">They confess</div>
                     <div class="line">Toward thee forgetfulness too general, gross:</div>
                     <div class="line">Which now the public body, which doth seldom</div>
                     <div class="line">Play the recanter, feeling in itself</div>
                     <div class="line">A lack of Timon's aid, hath sense withal</div>
                     <div class="line">Of its own fail, restraining aid to Timon;</div>
                     <div class="line">And send forth us, to make their sorrow'd render,</div>
                     <div class="line">Together with a recompense more fruitful</div>
                     <div class="line">Than their offence can weigh down by the dram;</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, even such heaps and sums of love and wealth</div>
                     <div class="line">As shall to thee blot out what wrongs were theirs</div>
                     <div class="line">And write in thee the figures of their love,</div>
                     <div class="line">Ever to read them thine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">You witch me in it;</div>
                     <div class="line">Surprise me to the very brink of tears:</div>
                     <div class="line">Lend me a fool's heart and a woman's eyes,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I'll beweep these comforts, worthy senators.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore, so please thee to return with us</div>
                     <div class="line">And of our Athens, thine and ours, to take</div>
                     <div class="line">The captainship, thou shalt be met with thanks,</div>
                     <div class="line">Allow'd with absolute power and thy good name</div>
                     <div class="line">Live with authority: so soon we shall drive back</div>
                     <div class="line">Of Alcibiades the approaches wild,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, like a boar too savage, doth root up</div>
                     <div class="line">His country's peace.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">And shakes his threatening sword</div>
                     <div class="line">Against the walls of Athens.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore, Timon,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, sir, I will; therefore, I will, sir; thus:</div>
                     <div class="line">If Alcibiades kill my countrymen,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let Alcibiades know this of Timon,</div>
                     <div class="line">That Timon cares not. But if be sack fair Athens,</div>
                     <div class="line">And take our goodly aged men by the beards,</div>
                     <div class="line">Giving our holy virgins to the stain</div>
                     <div class="line">Of contumelious, beastly, mad-brain'd war,</div>
                     <div class="line">Then let him know, and tell him Timon speaks it,</div>
                     <div class="line">In pity of our aged and our youth,</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot choose but tell him, that I care not,</div>
                     <div class="line">And let him take't at worst; for their knives care not,</div>
                     <div class="line">While you have throats to answer: for myself,</div>
                     <div class="line">There's not a whittle in the unruly camp</div>
                     <div class="line">But I do prize it at my love before</div>
                     <div class="line">The reverend'st throat in Athens. So I leave you</div>
                     <div class="line">To the protection of the prosperous gods,</div>
                     <div class="line">As thieves to keepers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FLAVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Stay not, all's in vain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, I was writing of my epitaph;</div>
                     <div class="line">it will be seen to-morrow: my long sickness</div>
                     <div class="line">Of health and living now begins to mend,</div>
                     <div class="line">And nothing brings me all things. Go, live still;</div>
                     <div class="line">Be Alcibiades your plague, you his,</div>
                     <div class="line">And last so long enough!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">We speak in vain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">But yet I love my country, and am not</div>
                     <div class="line">One that rejoices in the common wreck,</div>
                     <div class="line">As common bruit doth put it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">That's well spoke.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Commend me to my loving countrymen,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">These words become your lips as they pass</div>
                     <div class="line">thorough them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">And enter in our ears like great triumphers</div>
                     <div class="line">In their applauding gates.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Commend me to them,</div>
                     <div class="line">And tell them that, to ease them of their griefs,</div>
                     <div class="line">Their fears of hostile strokes, their aches, losses,</div>
                     <div class="line">Their pangs of love, with other incident throes</div>
                     <div class="line">That nature's fragile vessel doth sustain</div>
                     <div class="line">In life's uncertain voyage, I will some kindness do them:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll teach them to prevent wild Alcibiades' wrath.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">I like this well; he will return again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">I have a tree, which grows here in my close,</div>
                     <div class="line">That mine own use invites me to cut down,</div>
                     <div class="line">And shortly must I fell it: tell my friends,</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell Athens, in the sequence of degree</div>
                     <div class="line">From high to low throughout, that whoso please</div>
                     <div class="line">To stop affliction, let him take his haste,</div>
                     <div class="line">Come hither, ere my tree hath felt the axe,</div>
                     <div class="line">And hang himself. I pray you, do my greeting.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FLAVIUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Trouble him no further; thus you still shall find him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TIMON</div>
                     <div class="line">Come not to me again: but say to Athens,</div>
                     <div class="line">Timon hath made his everlasting mansion</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon the beached verge of the salt flood;</div>
                     <div class="line">Who once a day with his embossed froth</div>
                     <div class="line">The turbulent surge shall cover: thither come,</div>
                     <div class="line">And let my grave-stone be your oracle.</div>
                     <div class="line">Lips, let sour words go by and language end:</div>
                     <div class="line">What is amiss plague and infection mend!</div>
                     <div class="line">Graves only be men's works and death their gain!</div>
                     <div class="line">Sun, hide thy beams! Timon hath done his reign.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Retires to his cave</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">His discontents are unremoveably</div>
                     <div class="line">Coupled to nature.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Our hope in him is dead: let us return,</div>
                     <div class="line">And strain what other means is left unto us</div>
                     <div class="line">In our dear peril.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">It requires swift foot.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  Before the walls of Athens.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter two Senators and a Messenger</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hast painfully discover'd: are his files</div>
                     <div class="line">As full as thy report?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">have spoke the least:</div>
                     <div class="line">Besides, his expedition promises</div>
                     <div class="line">Present approach.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">We stand much hazard, if they bring not Timon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">I met a courier, one mine ancient friend;</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom, though in general part we were opposed,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet our old love made a particular force,</div>
                     <div class="line">And made us speak like friends: this man was riding</div>
                     <div class="line">From Alcibiades to Timon's cave,</div>
                     <div class="line">With letters of entreaty, which imported</div>
                     <div class="line">His fellowship i' the cause against your city,</div>
                     <div class="line">In part for his sake moved.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Here come our brothers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter the Senators from TIMON</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">No talk of Timon, nothing of him expect.</div>
                     <div class="line">The enemies' drum is heard, and fearful scouring</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth choke the air with dust: in, and prepare:</div>
                     <div class="line">Ours is the fall, I fear; our foes the snare.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  The woods. Timon's cave, and a rude tomb seen.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a Soldier, seeking TIMON</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">By all description this should be the place.</div>
                     <div class="line">Who's here? speak, ho! No answer! What is this?</div>
                     <div class="line">Timon is dead, who hath outstretch'd his span:</div>
                     <div class="line">Some beast rear'd this; there does not live a man.</div>
                     <div class="line">Dead, sure; and this his grave. What's on this tomb</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot read; the character I'll take with wax:</div>
                     <div class="line">Our captain hath in every figure skill,</div>
                     <div class="line">An aged interpreter, though young in days:</div>
                     <div class="line">Before proud Athens he's set down by this,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose fall the mark of his ambition is.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  Before the walls of Athens.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Trumpets sound. Enter ALCIBIADES with his powers</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">Sound to this coward and lascivious town</div>
                     <div class="line">Our terrible approach.</div>
                     <p>A parley sounded</p>
                     <p>Enter Senators on the walls</p>
                     <div class="line">Till now you have gone on and fill'd the time</div>
                     <div class="line">With all licentious measure, making your wills</div>
                     <div class="line">The scope of justice; till now myself and such</div>
                     <div class="line">As slept within the shadow of your power</div>
                     <div class="line">Have wander'd with our traversed arms and breathed</div>
                     <div class="line">Our sufferance vainly: now the time is flush,</div>
                     <div class="line">When crouching marrow in the bearer strong</div>
                     <div class="line">Cries of itself 'No more:' now breathless wrong</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall sit and pant in your great chairs of ease,</div>
                     <div class="line">And pursy insolence shall break his wind</div>
                     <div class="line">With fear and horrid flight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Noble and young,</div>
                     <div class="line">When thy first griefs were but a mere conceit,</div>
                     <div class="line">Ere thou hadst power or we had cause of fear,</div>
                     <div class="line">We sent to thee, to give thy rages balm,</div>
                     <div class="line">To wipe out our ingratitude with loves</div>
                     <div class="line">Above their quantity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">So did we woo</div>
                     <div class="line">Transformed Timon to our city's love</div>
                     <div class="line">By humble message and by promised means:</div>
                     <div class="line">We were not all unkind, nor all deserve</div>
                     <div class="line">The common stroke of war.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">These walls of ours</div>
                     <div class="line">Were not erected by their hands from whom</div>
                     <div class="line">You have received your griefs; nor are they such</div>
                     <div class="line">That these great towers, trophies and schools</div>
                     <div class="line">should fall</div>
                     <div class="line">For private faults in them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor are they living</div>
                     <div class="line">Who were the motives that you first went out;</div>
                     <div class="line">Shame that they wanted cunning, in excess</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath broke their hearts. March, noble lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">Into our city with thy banners spread:</div>
                     <div class="line">By decimation, and a tithed death--</div>
                     <div class="line">If thy revenges hunger for that food</div>
                     <div class="line">Which nature loathes--take thou the destined tenth,</div>
                     <div class="line">And by the hazard of the spotted die</div>
                     <div class="line">Let die the spotted.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">All have not offended;</div>
                     <div class="line">For those that were, it is not square to take</div>
                     <div class="line">On those that are, revenges: crimes, like lands,</div>
                     <div class="line">Are not inherited. Then, dear countryman,</div>
                     <div class="line">Bring in thy ranks, but leave without thy rage:</div>
                     <div class="line">Spare thy Athenian cradle and those kin</div>
                     <div class="line">Which in the bluster of thy wrath must fall</div>
                     <div class="line">With those that have offended: like a shepherd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Approach the fold and cull the infected forth,</div>
                     <div class="line">But kill not all together.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">What thou wilt,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou rather shalt enforce it with thy smile</div>
                     <div class="line">Than hew to't with thy sword.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Senator </div>
                     <div class="line">Set but thy foot</div>
                     <div class="line">Against our rampired gates, and they shall ope;</div>
                     <div class="line">So thou wilt send thy gentle heart before,</div>
                     <div class="line">To say thou'lt enter friendly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Senator</div>
                     <div class="line">Throw thy glove,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or any token of thine honour else,</div>
                     <div class="line">That thou wilt use the wars as thy redress</div>
                     <div class="line">And not as our confusion, all thy powers</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall make their harbour in our town, till we</div>
                     <div class="line">Have seal'd thy full desire.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">Then there's my glove;</div>
                     <div class="line">Descend, and open your uncharged ports:</div>
                     <div class="line">Those enemies of Timon's and mine own</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom you yourselves shall set out for reproof</div>
                     <div class="line">Fall and no more: and, to atone your fears</div>
                     <div class="line">With my more noble meaning, not a man</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall pass his quarter, or offend the stream</div>
                     <div class="line">Of regular justice in your city's bounds,</div>
                     <div class="line">But shall be render'd to your public laws</div>
                     <div class="line">At heaviest answer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Both</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis most nobly spoken.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">Descend, and keep your words.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>The Senators descend, and open the gates</p>
               <p>Enter Soldier</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">My noble general, Timon is dead;</div>
                     <div class="line">Entomb'd upon the very hem o' the sea;</div>
                     <div class="line">And on his grave-stone this insculpture, which</div>
                     <div class="line">With wax I brought away, whose soft impression</div>
                     <div class="line">Interprets for my poor ignorance.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALCIBIADES</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads the epitaph</span>  'Here lies a</div>
                     <div class="line">wretched corse, of wretched soul bereft:</div>
                     <div class="line">Seek not my name: a plague consume you wicked</div>
                     <div class="line">caitiffs left!</div>
                     <div class="line">Here lie I, Timon; who, alive, all living men did hate:</div>
                     <div class="line">Pass by and curse thy fill, but pass and stay</div>
                     <div class="line">not here thy gait.'</div>
                     <div class="line">These well express in thee thy latter spirits:</div>
                     <div class="line">Though thou abhorr'dst in us our human griefs,</div>
                     <div class="line">Scorn'dst our brain's flow and those our</div>
                     <div class="line">droplets which</div>
                     <div class="line">From niggard nature fall, yet rich conceit</div>
                     <div class="line">Taught thee to make vast Neptune weep for aye</div>
                     <div class="line">On thy low grave, on faults forgiven. Dead</div>
                     <div class="line">Is noble Timon: of whose memory</div>
                     <div class="line">Hereafter more. Bring me into your city,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I will use the olive with my sword,</div>
                     <div class="line">Make war breed peace, make peace stint war, make each</div>
                     <div class="line">Prescribe to other as each other's leech.</div>
                     <div class="line">Let our drums strike.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
      </article>
      <script src="../../resources/js/prism.js"/>
   </body>
</html>

   <head>
      <link href="../../resources/css/db-prism.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>

      <link href="../../resources/css/prism.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>
      <link href="../../resources/css/publishers.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>
      <meta charset="utf-8"/>
      <meta content="DocBook XSL 2.0 Stylesheets Vxxx" name="generator"/>
      <script src="../../resources/js/dbmodnizr.js" type="text/javascript"/>
      <title>The Life of Timon of Athens</title>
   </head>

      <article class="book" id="R.1">
         <header class="book-titlepage">
            <h1>The Life of Timon of Athens</h1>
         </header>
         <div class="lists-of-titles">

                           </span>

                           </span>

                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.5">4. SCENE IV.  Before the walls of Athens.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
               </ul>
            </div>
         </div>
         <div class="content">
            <article class="preface" id="R.1.2">
               <header class="preface-titlepage">
                  <h2>Dramatis Personae</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="content">
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">TIMON, of Athens.</span>
                  </p>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">LUCIUS</span>
                              <span class="personname">LUCULLUS</span>
                              <span class="personname">SEMPRONIUS</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">flattering lords.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">VENTIDIUS, one of Timon's false friends.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">ALCIBIADES, an Athenian captain.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">APEMANTUS, a churlish philosopher.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">FLAVIUS, steward to Timon.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Poet, Painter, Jeweller, and Merchant. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">An old Athenian. </span>
                  </p>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">FLAMINIUS</span>
                              <span class="personname">LUCILIUS</span>
                              <span class="personname">SERVILIUS</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">servants to Timon.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">CAPHIS</span>
                              <span class="personname">PHILOTUS</span>
                              <span class="personname">TITUS</span>
                              <span class="personname">LUCIUS</span>
                              <span class="personname">HORTENSIUS</span>
                              <span class="personname">And others</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">servants to Timon's creditors.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">A Page. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">A Fool. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Three Strangers.</span>
                  </p>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">PHRYNIA</span>
                              <span class="personname">TIMANDRA</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">mistresses to Alcibiades.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Cupid and Amazons in the mask. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Other Lords, Senators, Officers, Soldiers, Banditti, and Attendants.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>SCENE  Athens, and the neighbouring woods.</p>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.3">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 1. ACT I</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.2">1. SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.3">2. SCENE II.  A banqueting-room in Timon's house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  Athens. A hall in Timon's house.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter Poet, Painter, Jeweller, Merchant, and
others, at several doors</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Poet</div>
                              <div class="line">Good day, sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Painter</div>
                              <div class="line">I am glad you're well.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Poet</div>
                              <div class="line">I have not seen you long: how goes the world?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Painter</div>
                              <div class="line">It wears, sir, as it grows.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Poet</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, that's well known:</div>
                              <div class="line">But what particular rarity? what strange,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which manifold record not matches? See,</div>
                              <div class="line">Magic of bounty! all these spirits thy power</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath conjured to attend. I know the merchant.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Painter</div>
                              <div class="line">I know them both; th' other's a jeweller.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Merchant</div>
                              <div class="line">O, 'tis a worthy lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Jeweller</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, that's most fix'd.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Merchant</div>
                              <div class="line">A most incomparable man, breathed, as it were,</div>
                              <div class="line">To an untirable and continuate goodness:</div>
                              <div class="line">He passes.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Jeweller:</div>
                              <div class="line">I have a jewel here--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Merchant</div>
                              <div class="line">O, pray, let's see't: for the Lord Timon, sir?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Jeweller:</div>
                              <div class="line">If he will touch the estimate: but, for that--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Poet</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Reciting to himself</span>  'When we for recompense have</div>
                              <div class="line">praised the vile,</div>
                              <div class="line">It stains the glory in that happy verse</div>
                              <div class="line">Which aptly sings the good.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Merchant</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis a good form.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Looking at the jewel</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Jeweller</div>
                              <div class="line">And rich: here is a water, look ye.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Painter</div>
                              <div class="line">You are rapt, sir, in some work, some dedication</div>
                              <div class="line">To the great lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Poet</div>
                              <div class="line">A thing slipp'd idly from me.</div>
                              <div class="line">Our poesy is as a gum, which oozes</div>
                              <div class="line">From whence 'tis nourish'd: the fire i' the flint</div>
                              <div class="line">Shows not till it be struck; our gentle flame</div>
                              <div class="line">Provokes itself and like the current flies</div>
                              <div class="line">Each bound it chafes. What have you there?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Painter</div>
                              <div class="line">A picture, sir. When comes your book forth?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Poet</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon the heels of my presentment, sir.</div>
                              <div class="line">Let's see your piece.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Painter</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis a good piece.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Poet</div>
                              <div class="line">So 'tis: this comes off well and excellent.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Painter</div>
                              <div class="line">Indifferent.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Poet</div>
                              <div class="line">Admirable: how this grace</div>
                              <div class="line">Speaks his own standing! what a mental power</div>
                              <div class="line">This eye shoots forth! how big imagination</div>
                              <div class="line">Moves in this lip! to the dumbness of the gesture</div>
                              <div class="line">One might interpret.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Painter</div>
                              <div class="line">It is a pretty mocking of the life.</div>
                              <div class="line">Here is a touch; is't good?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Poet</div>
                              <div class="line">I will say of it,</div>
                              <div class="line">It tutors nature: artificial strife</div>
                              <div class="line">Lives in these touches, livelier than life.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter certain Senators, and pass over</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Painter</div>
                              <div class="line">How this lord is follow'd!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Poet</div>
                              <div class="line">The senators of Athens: happy man!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Painter</div>
                              <div class="line">Look, more!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Poet</div>
                              <div class="line">You see this confluence, this great flood</div>
                              <div class="line">of visitors.</div>
                              <div class="line">I have, in this rough work, shaped out a man,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whom this beneath world doth embrace and hug</div>
                              <div class="line">With amplest entertainment: my free drift</div>
                              <div class="line">Halts not particularly, but moves itself</div>
                              <div class="line">In a wide sea of wax: no levell'd malice</div>
                              <div class="line">Infects one comma in the course I hold;</div>
                              <div class="line">But flies an eagle flight, bold and forth on,</div>
                              <div class="line">Leaving no tract behind.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Painter</div>
                              <div class="line">How shall I understand you?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Poet</div>
                              <div class="line">I will unbolt to you.</div>
                              <div class="line">You see how all conditions, how all minds,</div>
                              <div class="line">As well of glib and slippery creatures as</div>
                              <div class="line">Of grave and austere quality, tender down</div>
                              <div class="line">Their services to Lord Timon: his large fortune</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon his good and gracious nature hanging</div>
                              <div class="line">Subdues and properties to his love and tendance</div>
                              <div class="line">All sorts of hearts; yea, from the glass-faced flatterer</div>
                              <div class="line">To Apemantus, that few things loves better</div>
                              <div class="line">Than to abhor himself: even he drops down</div>
                              <div class="line">The knee before him, and returns in peace</div>
                              <div class="line">Most rich in Timon's nod.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Painter</div>
                              <div class="line">I saw them speak together.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Poet</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, I have upon a high and pleasant hill</div>
                              <div class="line">Feign'd Fortune to be throned: the base o' the mount</div>
                              <div class="line">Is rank'd with all deserts, all kind of natures,</div>
                              <div class="line">That labour on the bosom of this sphere</div>
                              <div class="line">To propagate their states: amongst them all,</div>
